isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTERS AND COOLER - OIL COOLER AND COOLANT FILTER HEADER ASSEMBLY - NEW DESIGN DESCRIPTION

step1.para:
The oil pressure regulating valve (OPRV) has been revised by adding two 1.06 mm (0.042 in.) dia. holes as shown in Figure 9.42
. The new design allows oil to flow into the regulating valve spring chamber, displacing any air in the chamber. The oil filled chamber dampens the regulating valve operation, acting as a hydraulic damper for the valve. This improved design eliminates regulating valve "pounding".

note.para: THE REVISED OIL PRESSURE REGULATING VALVE ASSEMBLY IS SHOWN IN FIGURE 9.43. AN O-RING AND REGULATING VALVE CAP GASKET ARE FURNISHED WITH THE ASSEMBLY IN A SERVICE PACKAGE. THE OIL PRESSURE REGULATING VALVE ASSEMBLY IS NOT SERVICED SEPARATELY. REFER TO THE LATEST PARTS CATALOG WHEN ORDERING SERVICE PARTS.
Current model production engines and all service use the revised design OPRV assembly. When confronted with an OPRV or bearing failure, replace the OPRV with the revised design OPRV assembly.
